page.title: 18CATERHAM HILL MARKET
page.content:
The{MARKET}is held every{THURSDAY}in the lower carpark of the{RAGLAN {PRECINCT}in Chaldon Road. It opened some years ago without permission. Local shopkeepers petitioned against it. After 3 years the House of Lords granted permission for it to be held. Now two-thirds of the shopkepers approve of it because it attracts more shoppers to the area.
There are 70 stalls run by 50 vendors; one travels 70 miles to sell here. Most stallholders also sell at other markets. The stalls sell clothes, china, meat, toys etc.
The market brings many people into the area creating competition. It has a car park above it but parking is difficult.
